trans-unit.source: Provides a container for metadata for a model.
The word *model* is used differently in the context of this class than it is typically used elsewhere.

In an ASP.NET Web Forms application, the <xref:System.Web.ModelBinding.ModelBindingContext.ModelType%2A> attribute of a data-bound control specifies the type of a data element that the data control is bound to.
This type is typically referred to as the model, and it typically corresponds to a row in a database table.
The properties of the model typically correspond to columns of the table.
A <xref:System.Web.ModelBinding.ModelMetadata> object can provide metadata for the model itself or for a property of the model, or for a property of a complex property.
When the <xref:System.Web.ModelBinding.ModelMetadata> object pertains to a property, the word *model* refers to the property, and the word *container* refers to the model.
For example, the model might be **Contact**, which has **Name** and **Age** properties, and the **Name** property might be a complex property composed of **FirstName** and **LastName**.
When the <xref:System.Web.ModelBinding.ModelMetadata> object pertains to the **Contact** object, the model type is **Contact** and there is no container.
When the <xref:System.Web.ModelBinding.ModelMetadata> object pertains to the **Name** property, the model type is **Name** and the container type is **Contact**.
When the <xref:System.Web.ModelBinding.ModelMetadata> object pertains to the **FirstName** property, the model type is **FirstName** and the container type is **Name**.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.ModelBinding.ModelMetadata"></xref> class.
The provider object.
The type of the container, or `null` to create metadata for the model type.
The model accessor.
The type of the model.
The name of the property, or `null` to create metadata for the model type.
Gets a collection that contains additional metadata about the model.
A collection that contains additional metadata about the model.
Gets the type of the container.
The type of the container, or `null` if there is no container.
Gets or sets a value that determines whether empty strings that are submitted in forms should be converted to `null`.
`true` if empty strings should be converted to `null`; otherwise, `false`.
The default value is `true`.
Gets or sets the name of the data type.
This property can be used to provide additional information about the type of data that is stored by the model.

For example, if the <xref:System.Web.ModelBinding.ModelMetadata.ModelType%2A> property is set to <xref:System.String>, this property might be "EmailAddress" or "Url" â€” that is, a name that indicates more than just that the data is typed as a string.
The name of the data type.
An integer value that is always set to 10000.
Gets or sets text that describes the model.
The description text.
Gets or sets a format string that should be applied when the model is displayed in display mode (as opposed to in edit mode).
The format string.
Gets or sets the text to use in UI when the name of the model is displayed.
The text to use as the name of the model.
Gets or sets the format string to use in UI in edit mode.
The format string.
Returns text to display as the name of the model in UI.
Text to display as the name of the model in UI.
The default is the value of the <xref href="System.Web.ModelBinding.ModelMetadata.DisplayName"></xref> property if that value is not `null`.

If the <xref href="System.Web.ModelBinding.ModelMetadata.DisplayName"></xref> property is `null`, the default value is the value of the <xref href="System.Web.ModelBinding.ModelMetadata.PropertyName"></xref> property.

If the <xref href="System.Web.ModelBinding.ModelMetadata.PropertyName"></xref> property is `null`, the default value comes from the <xref href="System.Reflection.MemberInfo.Name"></xref> property of the <xref href="System.Web.ModelBinding.ModelMetadata.ModelType"></xref> property.
Returns text to display for the model when the model represents a complex object.
The property value is derived by examining the following sequence of related values until a return value is found.
If the <xref href="System.Web.ModelBinding.ModelMetadata.SimpleDisplayText"></xref> property value is not `null`, that value is returned.
If the <xref href="System.Web.ModelBinding.ModelMetadata.Model"></xref> property is `null`, the <xref href="System.Web.ModelBinding.ModelMetadata.NullDisplayText"></xref> property value is returned.
If an attempt to convert the <xref href="System.Web.ModelBinding.ModelMetadata.Model"></xref> property to a string returns `null`, an empty string is returned.

If the string conversion of the <xref href="System.Web.ModelBinding.ModelMetadata.Model"></xref> property value is the same as the <xref href="System.Type.FullName"></xref> property of the <xref href="System.Web.ModelBinding.ModelMetadata.Model"></xref> property type, that value is returned.
If there are no properties in the <xref href="System.Web.ModelBinding.ModelMetadata.Properties"></xref> collection, an empty string is returned.
If none of the preceding tests have returned a value, the return value comes from the first property in the <xref href="System.Web.ModelBinding.ModelMetadata.Properties"></xref> collection.

If the <xref href="System.Web.ModelBinding.ModelMetadata.Model"></xref> property of the first property is `null`, the <xref href="System.Web.ModelBinding.ModelMetadata.NullDisplayText"></xref> property value is returned; otherwise the result of converting the first property's <xref href="System.Web.ModelBinding.ModelMetadata.Model"></xref> property to a string is returned.
Returns a collection of validators that apply to the model.
The model binding execution context.
A collection of validators.
Gets or sets a value that determines whether surrounding HTML should be hidden.
`true` if surrounding HTML should be hidden; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a value that specifies whether the model is a complex type.
Built-in .NET Framework types are not considered complex types for purposes of this property.
`true` if the model is a complex type; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a value that specifies whether the model is a nullable value type.
`true` if the model is a nullable value type; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the model can be updated.
`true` if the model is read-only; otherwise, `false` The default is `false`.
Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the property is required.
`true` if the property is required; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `true` for non-nullable value types and `false` for all other types.
Gets or sets the model object.
The model object.
Gets the type of the model.
The type of the model.
Gets the string that should be displayed when the model is `null`.
The string to display when the model is `null`.
Gets or sets an integer that indicates the order in which to display this property relative to other properties.
The relative order in which to display this property.
Gets a collection of model metadata objects that describe the properties of the model.
Metadata for all properties in the model.
Gets the name of the property.
The name of the property if the model is a property; otherwise, `null`.
Gets or sets the provider object for this metadata.
The provider object for this metadata.
Gets or sets a value that specifies whether request validation is enabled.
`true` if request validation is enabled; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `true`.
Gets or sets a short version of the display name.
The short display name can be used in a tooltip or in any UI where the complete display name might not fit.
If this field is `null`, the <xref:System.Web.ModelBinding.ModelMetadata.DisplayName%2A> property should be used.
The text to display when a short version of the model name is required.
Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the model should be displayed in the UI in display mode (as opposed to edit mode).
`true` if the model should be displayed in display mode; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `true`.
Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the property should be displayed in edit mode (as opposed to display mode).
`true` if the property should be displayed in edit mode; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `true`.
Gets or sets text to display for the model when the model represents a complex object
Text to display in UI for a complex object.
The default value is determined by calling the <xref href="System.Web.ModelBinding.ModelMetadata.GetSimpleDisplayText"></xref> method.
Gets or sets a value that indicates what template (data control) should be used in UI for the model.
A value that indicates what template (data control) should be used in UI for the model.
Gets or sets watermark text for a text box.
This property contains text to display as a watermark when a property is rendered for editing in a text box.
The default value is `null`.
The watermark text.
